poem:
### The Unforeseen

A chorus of certainty—  
Starmer, Farage, Lammy,  
claimed a new dawn;  
prophecies dissolved  
amid morning's stark  
newsprint.

Kamala's silent gaze  
in shadowed corners—  
replaced by the din  
of disbelief's echo,  
Trump triumphant  
in chaos  
while predictions scatter  
like autumn leaves  
on city streets.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Congratulations, your serene highness: Starmer, Farage and Lammy call Trump | John Crace Rory Stewart: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the 47th president of the United States of America, Kamala Harris. Kamala Harris: Er … Actually, I lost. Stewart: You can’t have done. I’m never wrong. I’m the political messiah. Alastair Campbell: I’m sorry to break it to you, but Donald Trump won. I can’t believe American voters didn’t pay attention to our predictions.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Congratulations, your serene highness: Starmer, Farage and Lammy call Trump | John Crace Rory Stewart: Ladies and gentlemen, I give you the 47th president of the United States of America, Kamala Harris. Kamala Harris: Er … Actually, I lost. Stewart: You can’t have done. I’m never wrong. I’m the political messiah. Alastair Campbell: I’m sorry to break it to you, but Donald Trump won. I can’t believe American voters didn’t pay attention to our predictions.
